summary: This is an email chain from December 2018, referencing earlier communications from 2016. It involves a U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) inquiry about a meeting and includes forwarded emails from attorney Peter Skinner discussing Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women and sharing legal documents related to a case.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney who forwarded a news article about Jeffrey Epstein's relationships with young women and shared legal documents with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Lead attorney on a case involving Jeffrey Epstein, added to an email chain by Peter Skinner for follow-up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded news article from 2016 reporting on his continued relationships with young women.

connections.description: Peter Skinner adds Sigrid McCawley to an email chain, indicating they are both attorneys working on the same case.
Peter Skinner is sharing legal documents and information related to a case involving Jeffrey Epstein.
Sigrid McCawley is described as a lead attorney on a case involving Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: New York Post Article on Epstein
events.description: The New York Post reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Meeting with U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: Peter Skinner thanks the U.S. Attorney's Office for a meeting and provides legal documents for review, including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 form.

events.title: Inquiry About Meeting
events.description: A follow-up email from 2018 asks if a meeting (or any related meeting) actually occurred and requests any notes or records.

keyFacts: In March 2016, the New York Post reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, linking him to his East Side mansion and 'Russian playmates'.
Attorney Peter Skinner shared legal documents with the U.S. Attorney's Office in February 2016, including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 form (EFTA00098041).
Sigrid McCawley is identified as a lead attorney on a case involving Jeffrey Epstein and was included in communications with federal prosecutors.
In December 2018, there was a follow-up inquiry from the U.S. Attorney's Office asking whether a previously discussed meeting had occurred and requesting any related notes or records.
